{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.04607v1", "title": "Experimental demonstration of a multi-particle collective measurement
  for optimal quantum state estimation", "summary": "We experimentally demonstrate a two-particle collective measurement proposed
as the optimal solution to a quantum state estimation game. Our results suggest
that, in practice, the collective measurement strategy is at least as good as
the best local approach, and it achieves a higher average fidelity when
accounting for systematic errors. This photonic implementation uses a recently
developed universal two-photon projective measurement based on Hong-Ou-Mandel
interference, polarization-dependent loss, and unitary operations. We compare
the performance to the case where the entangling component of the measurement
is suppressed. We further apply the collective measurement to quantum state
tomography, observing a near-optimal scaling of the infidelity with the total
number of samples.", "main_category": "quant-ph", "categories": "quant-ph", "published": "2025-05-07T17:53:25Z"}
